text:
number field feedback / ideas – especially with half_width
• can we get a standard width on the text input with number sliders (chopping values off)?
• can there be a more opacified number value and slider circle for number sliders without a default value (see 2nd slider 0px with 1px minimum? maybe no placeholder text)
• can we add standard up and down increment buttons on the slider number? Sometimes I wish had them even when displayed as a slider

Hi there! Not sure where this question should go, so I thought here would be a good a place as any? Is there currently any functionality that allows for a single line field in a form to be validated against an existing database/list/property? The example I'm asking for is the case of asking for company information on a form. There are far too many companies for a drop down list to make sense, but I'd like the user to be able to fill out the form and have their company populate (similar to how an address validator populates as you begin typing your address). Thanks in advance for any thoughts/help!
Hey Patrick, this is possible but would need to be custom developed, and may need serverless functions (CMS Enterprise) depending on the implementation.

You could also make something like this work using hubDB and js. If you need to hide the companies and what not you can store the logic in hubl on a separate page and make an Ajax call to that page passing info using the query param. 

This would only require cms professional.
